item.title: Mapping Hospitals
item.description: Mapping Hospitals My goal was to build a highly interactive, informative, and easy-to-understand map of hospitals in the United States. I went through a lot of methods to create this final product, but landed on a combination of Shiny, ggplot2, and plotly to create my final map. The project looks like this: This piece was a part of a larger article on hospitals, published on Canopy. Below, Iâ€™ll walk you through the creation of the final map.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
